gale:repo.gale:text: the process of locating, modifying and presenting content suitable to a particular user, based on a request by that user

An adaptive hypermedia system will at some point return different output for different users. When [[../gale|GALE]] receives a request for a particular concept, a process is started to [[locating-content|adaptively locate]] a 'suitable' resource, based on the [[user-model|user model]].
Depending on the type of resource, GALE may perform additional [[modifying-resource|modifications to the resource]] itself. This happens when the resource is an HTML, XHTML or XML file, for instance. Finally, the [[presentation]] of the resource might depend on a particular user. Selecting a layout and/or the content of views (portions of the screen that display information or a menu) can be completely adaptive.
